definition: fortune as unpredictable as the weather, every day may bring fortune or calamity (idiom); sth unexpected may happen at any moment
pinyin: tian1 you3 bu4 ce4 feng1 yun2 , ren2 you3 dan4 xi1 huo4 fu2
traditional: 天有不測風雲，人有旦夕禍福
word: 天有不测风云，人有旦夕祸福

definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
dawn/morning/daybreak/day/dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
misfortune does not come singly (idiom)/it never rains but it pours
God's plans supersede our own/Man proposes but God disposes
pinyin: ren2 suan4 bu4 ru2 tian1 suan4

definition: one is bound for good fortune after surviving a great disaster (proverb)
pinyin: da4 nan4 bu4 si3 , bi4 you3 hou4 fu2

definition: the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 yan1 zhi1 fei1 fu2

definition: Heaven never bars one's way (idiom); don't despair and you will find a way through./Never give up hope./Never say die.
pinyin: tian1 wu2 jue2 ren2 zhi1 lu4

definition: heaven is jealous of heroic genius (idiom); the great have great hardship to contend with/those whom the Gods love die young
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
(idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic
lit. the trees long for peace but the wind will never cease (idiom)/fig. the world changes, whether you want it or not
pinyin: shu4 yu4 jing4 er2 feng1 bu4 zhi3

definition: to leave one's mortal frame (idiom)/to die
